trash to recycle
Who are you ?
You're not welcome here !
Go away !
You're not a member of those industrialists who want to build a mine ?
Sorry for my rude welcome…
We're on edge for a few days now.
Since these men came to tell us that they would build a mine.
To dig the ground, in search of precious materials.
But to mine they want to pollute one of our beautiful rivers.
Ahhh! Can't you hear, they started cutting down the trees !
If you want to know more, you'll find them to the west !
Welcome to our village, stranger. You will see, our rivers are magnificent, finally not for long...
If you want to know more, I advise you to go see the village chief.
I don't like talking to strangers.
There are many problems because of the mine at the moment.
Leave me alone, I have carrots to grow !
Oh ! a new face.
Welcome to three rivers.
Welcome to the region's great Copper and Lithium Mine.
Everything you see here works day and night to extract tons of ore.
It's hard work, but it's the price you pay to power today's connected world.
Water? Oh yes, we use monstrous quantities of it to cool the machines and wash the ore.
The impact on groundwater? Let's just say the water doesn't blame us out loud, so it's all good, right?
Especially the people from the nearby village; they keep giving me problems.
I hope you didn't come here because of them?
Do you want work? We always need extra hands to dig deeper.
So, are you willing to get your hands dirty for a little money and a lot of dust?
In that case I have a job for you
Good job, you've done well today.
You can go and rest, don't forget to come back sometimes.
I don't have any more work for you, come back another day.
Lithium doesn't extract itself. Each battery demands sacrifices.
The earth here contains precious metals. Your talking time costs me too much !
Each minute here is more rare metals for our phones. Don't slow me down.
I don't have time, I have to extract tons of copper for our printed circuits.
Wait... I know you. You were in Three Rivers years ago, weren't you?
Things have changed since then. We've changed.
But not all for the better...
You've seen the new river, haven't you? The one that's turned brown.
It's the price we pay for progress. The assembly plant needs water, and it gives us technology in return.
But sometimes I wonder... was it worth it?
If you want to see the source of our problems, head north of the city.
That's where the assembly plant is. Maybe you'll understand why we're stuck between progress and destruction.
Be careful though... not everyone there is friendly.
Back from the mine? Did you see the river?
It's all polluted from mining activities.
Hey, you're not from around here, are you? Things have changed a lot since the factory arrived. The river is almost dry now...
If you want to know more, you should talk to the village chief. He's the one who knows everything.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I have customers to serve.
I used to swim in the river when I was a kid. Now it's just a trickle... Everything's changed since the factory came.
If you want to know more, go see the village chief. He'll tell you everything.
I don't have time to chat, I have to get to work.
Back in my day, the river was full of life. Now it's just a shadow of what it used to be...
If you want to know more, go see the village chief. He knows everything about what's happened.
Now, leave me be, I need to rest.
I don't like talking to strangers, but I'll tell you this: the river is dying, and so is our way of life.
If you want to know more, go see the village chief. He's the one who deals with these things.
And if you can, tell him for me that I don't like the factory, even if he gives me a smartphone.
Now, leave me alone. I have work to do.
Welcome to the assembly plant, the beating heart of modern industry.
I am the head of this factory, it is me who runs it with a few workers from the Three Rivers village.
We pump thousands of liters of water every day to extract rare metals essential for smartphones and other gadgets.
Every drop of contaminated water returns to the river, but people love their screens far more than clean air, don't they?
Me? I keep the machine running. As long as it's profitable, why stop?
If you want to join us, there are always positions available for the brave.
Good job, you've done well today.
You can go and rest, don't forget to come back sometimes.
You can leave for now, I have other workers to replace you.
Every day, I assemble hundreds of smartphones. It's a tough job, but it pays the bills.
It's not easy to work here, but it's better than nothing.
It's a shame that the river is so polluted, but what can we do?
It's not like we can stop the factory from working...
Now leave me, I have a lot of work.
I work on the line, no time to talk.
I'm behind on production.
You've come to see the recycling plant, haven't you? It's a blessing and a curse...
We recycle what we can, but not everything can be saved. The river pays the price.
If you want to understand how we got here, talk to the workers. They'll tell you the truth.
But remember, even if it's not perfect, recycling is better than nothing.
You're back, it's been a long time since you left to work at the factory.
As you can see, our town has changed a lot too.
But this came at the cost of another of our rivers.
Look behind you, the assembly plant has almost completely pumped it out.
Hi, it's my day off today.
Did you hear the news? A new factory opened
But I don't know any more than that. Go and ask the village chief to find out more.
I remember you from your mining days.
How am I doing? As you can see, I decided to settle here when the village became a town.
I still run the mine, but these days all anyone talks about is the recycling plant.
Bye-bye !
This used to be a quiet village. Now, the recycling plant brings jobs... and pollution.
If you want to know more, go see the village chief. He's the one who deals with all this.
Now if you'll excuse me, I have things to do.
The recycling plant is a double-edged sword. It helps, but it also destroys.
I don't like talking to strangers. If you want answers, go see the village chief.
Now, leave me alone.
I work at the recycling plant. It's hard, but it's better than the assembly factory.
Still, I wish the river wasn't so polluted... It used to be so clean.
If you want to know more, go see the village chief. I need to get back to work.
Back in my day, the river was full of fish. Now, it's full of waste from the recycling plant.
But what can we do? At least the plant gives us jobs...
If you want to know more, go see the village chief. I need to rest now.
Ah, a new face! Welcome to the recycling plant.
The last line of defense against ecological disaster, or at least… that's what we like to say to reassure ourselves.
Here, we give a second life to electronic devices, mainly mobile phones. These little wonders are full of precious metals like gold and copper.
Every day, we dismantle, sort, and melt down components to get some.
But not everything is as green as we'd like. Look at the river behind the plant... It carries the residue of our work.
Even with all our sophisticated machines, toxins still escape.
Nevertheless, the world needs us.
Without recycling, these wastes would end up in open-air landfills, poisoning the soil and the air.
So, what do you say? A little elbow grease to dismantle phones and help the future, or would you rather stay a spectator of this mess?
Good job, you've done well today.
You can go and rest, don't forget to come back sometimes.
You worked well today, go and rest.
I'm just doing my job !
Go see the boss, I'm just doing my job.
Many parts can be reused, which reduces the need for new materials.
But improper disposal of electronics can harm the environment.
So, always think before you throw away your old devices!
Go see the boss, I'm just doing my job
Oh, you're just in time.
We learned that a data center was going to be built next to the village.
It's going to destroy the environment even more, and we've had enough of it! So we're protesting!
Would you like to join us?
This data center will consume enormous amounts of energy. And guess where they'll get it from?
They don't care if it drains our resources. As long as they make money, right?
They say it'll bring jobs, but at what cost?
Pollution, water waste, and power outages... We've seen this before.
We fight every day to reduce waste, and now they want to build this monster?
If they were serious about the environment, they wouldn't even consider this.
We will not let them ruin our land without a fight!
Everyone, stay united! Our voices must be heard!
This is our home, not a playground for corporations!
If we don't act now, we'll regret it forever.
They think we'll just accept it? Not this time!
We have the power if we stand together!
Heh you! The adults have gathered in the town parking lot.
I don't know what's going on, but they're angry.
When I was young, this land was pure. Now, look at what they've done.
My grandchildren deserve better than a future full of concrete and smoke.
You've returned… and just in time to see what real change looks like.
The factories are gone. For the first time in years, the river flows clear.
For so long, we believed that to move forward we had to destroy what made us who we are, our
But we were wrong. Our people are happier. The land is healing.
But don't think we've forgotten technology just yet.
Quite simply, we've made the choice to consume better, to use healthier energi.
Our workers may build fewer cell phones, but they last longer.
You played a part in all this, whether you wanted to or not. And for that, you have my gratitude.
Stay as long as you like.
It's good to see you again !
Look around you, our village is much better! !
You've returned… and just in time to see what real change looks like.
You'd better go and see the village chief, he'll be happy to see you again.
You again! I feel like I see you every time something new happens...
But hey, for once I'm in a good mood, the village is better than ever.
Any questions? The village chief will be happy to answer them.
The river is blue again! I never thought I'd see this day.
No more pollution, no more noise… Just peace. And I like to see these windmills spinning.
Life feels normal again. It's like we can finally breathe.
Ah, there you are! Come on, no time to lose, we've got work to do. Welcome to the open-cast mine!
Here, we dig relentlessly to extract precious metals: lithium, cobalt, copper...
These little marvels power all your modern gadgets. But you know what? For a ton of rock, barely a few grams are useful.
It's true that it uses a bit of fuel and that some rivers are polluted, but that's not my problem.
There, trucks send the materials to the assembly plant.
Come on, get your pickaxe. If you hit it right, we might make a fortune... or just a little more pollution. Let's get started!
Hi, rookie! Welcome to the great digital dream factory.
Here, smartphones are assembled on a production line, from sunrise to sunset.
Every little component is a concentrate of technology and sweat.
Take a good look at the conveyor belts: motherboards, screens, batteries: treasures of precision.
But nothing comes without sacrifice. It takes water, tons of water, to clean all this up. That's why we're pumping the river right here.
It's true that over time it dries out, but it's got to be used if everyone wants their mobile!
Come on, get ready. You have to be quick and precise in this job.
Welcome to the factory where everything broken and obsolete arrives. Here, old electronics are sorted to recover what can be reused.
Every year, tens of millions of tonnes of electronic waste are generated.
So we need a lot of water to work. That's why we set up shop by the river.
It's true that we discharge waste into the water, but we have to work, don't we?
The aim is to recycle certain components, but we can't recycle them all. There are bound to be materials that have to be sent back to nature.
Well, you'll understand the rest as you work. Just pay attention to the useful component. Leave the rest in the river.
Faced with the threat of the destruction of their land, the inhabitants of Trois Rivières have risen up.
Industrialists were no match for their determination to protect rivers.
The construction site did not take place.
The workers and machines have left. The people of Trois Rivière have won
The wind, which had always blown over the hills of Trois Rivières, was now becoming a source of life.
The inhabitants had chosen a clean energy, respectful of their land.
Every ray of sunlight was another step towards autonomy and harmony with nature.
Although some residents regretted the laptops and innovations, the majority were happy.
The rivers had regained their clarity, and life, their brilliance.
The village still bore the scars of its industrial past, but these scars told a story of victory and resilience.
The people of Trois Rivières had chosen a different future. A future where man and nature could coexist in harmony.
End...
Según la Ademe, se necesitan unos 200 kilos de materias primas para fabricar un solo smartphone.
La batterie de ton téléphone contient du nickel, du lithium et du cobalt et bien d'autres éléments.
La batería de su teléfono contiene níquel, litio, cobalto y muchos otros elementos.
La fabricación de dispositivos electrónicos, como teléfonos inteligentes y ordenadores, contribuye al agotamiento de los recursos naturales.
La fabricación de semiconductores consume mucha agua, lo que aumenta la presión sobre los recursos hídricos.
En 2018 se fabricaron 1.500 millones de teléfonos móviles en todo el mundo.
En 2023, la producción de aparatos electrónicos generará 58 millones de toneladas de residuos electrónicos
El aumento de los residuos es una de las consecuencias más graves de la obsolescencia programada. Si no cambias de móvil todos los días, estás salvando los ríos.

The minerals and rocks will pass through the water line. 
Collect as many minerals as you can before time runs out. 
		Press the green button to start.

Finish off all the trucks carrying minerals before time runs out! 
		Click on a truck to make it move.
Trash will arrive, swap to make a line of at least 3 chips to recycle them, you can swap two at a time!
Well done! You managed to collect some minerals! Move on to the next step!
You didn't collect any minerals, try again!
Well done! You managed to get all the trucks out! Move on to the next step!
You didn't manage to get all the trucks out, try again!
You were fast, well done. You can move on to the next step!
You weren't fast enough, try again!
Too much waste has piled up, we can't recycle it anymore. Move on to the next step!
